meanings.definition: A condition in which the eyes do not properly align with each other.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the child with strabismus.
meanings.sent3: The silly glasses made his strabismus look even more pronounced.
meanings.sent4: Her conflicting opinions created a mental strabismus.
meanings.sent5: The crooked painting on the wall was like a visual representation of strabismus.

meanings.definition: The inability of the eyes to focus together on an object.
meanings.sent1: Strabismus can affect a person's depth perception.
meanings.sent2: The strabismus made it hard for him to read small print.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful strabismus made it look like it was winking.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was in a state of strabismus, unable to concentrate on one thing.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's strabismus with the spotlight created a mesmerizing effect on the audience.
